result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine/forfeiture of $2,500.00 PLUS costs. To be paid out of bail on deposit if any with the balance due at the rate of $200.00 commencing on 06-01-2017 and to be paid on the 1st of every month until paid in full. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M Fischer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Copy of Notice of Intent, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to Attorney BRADLEY J. BLOCH 400 W Moreland Blvd Waukesha, WI 53188.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 5-11-17.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to pay a fine/forfeiture of $2,500.00 plus costs to be paid out of bail on deposit, if any; and with the balance due at the rate of $200.00 commencing on 06-01-2017 an to be paid on the 1st of every month until paid in full.  Failure to pay shall shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Letter/Correspondence from NEP Electronics Inc.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D304B
cf

At the hour of 03:47 pm  the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY of Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon, specifically going  armed with a firearm while under the influence of an intoxicant which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Discussions held outside the presence of the jury. Jury in box at 09:25 am.  Sworn for the State: 2).  Officer Michael Bohn (WFBPD).  Direct examination.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7 marked, offered, and received into evidence.  Cross-Examination.  Side bar.  Jury out of box at 10:05 am.  Discussions held outside the presence of the jury.  Jury in box at 10:16 am. Redirect. Subject to rebuttal the State rest.  Jury out of box at 11:02 am. Jury in box at 11:39 am.  The Court adjourned the trial for lunch.  The Court instruct the jury and asked the jurors back by 01:20 pm.   Jury out of box at 11:40 am.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 01:25 pm.  Sworn for Defense: 1). Defendant, Sean M. Fischer. Direct Examination.  Cross-Examination.  Redirect. Defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 01:48 pm.  Discussions held outside the presence of the jury.  Jury in box at 02:26 pm.  Gadiosh and Buckenberger who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury out of  box for deliberations at 03:16 pm.
Received and filed with the court.

Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Jury out of the box at 3:40.  Strikes for cause placed on the record.  Jury in the box at 3:47.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Ofc. Russell Blank, WFBPD.  At the hour of 4:21pm, jury is excused for the day and ordered to return at 8:30am 3/9/17.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  1:55pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bradley J. Bloch in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  An Authorization to Appear and Act submitted to the court. The Court waived the appearance of the Defendant. Parties are prepared to proceed with the Jury Trial scheduled for 03-08-2017 at 09:00 am in Branch 45.  COURT WILL RETAI FILE.
Letter received and filed with the court.
Authorization To Appear received and filed with the court.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court DENIED the Motion for Reconsideration on the previous Motion to Dismiss. Defense requesting a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Jury Trial scheduled for March 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Final Pre-trial scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion To Deny Defense's Motion To Reconsider received and filed with the court.
Defendant's Motion To Reconsider The Circuit Court's April 8, 2016, Decision Denying Defendant's Motion To Dismiss: Unconstitutional Criminal Offense received and filed with the court.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense request for a Motion for Reconsideration. The State objects. Court will grant the request.  Motion Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
Original Transcript (9 pages) MOTION HEARING commencing 04-08-2016 received and filed.
Blood results by Guth Laboratories received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.
Received and filed.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury Trial scheduled for 09-07-2016 at 09:00 am in Branch 45.  COURT WILL RETAIL FILE.

Attorney Bradley J. Bloch in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Counsel waives defendant appearance for hearing.    Case in court for status conference.  For reasons placed on the record Defense requests final pre-trial and Jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  All parties are notified that effective 08-01-16 this case will be assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Bradley J. Bloch in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case calendar for status conference.  Counsel waives appearance for hearing.  For reasons stated on the record defense request more time.  Court waives appearance of defendant for next court.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

Case in court for decision on defense counsel's Motion To Dismiss Unconstitutional Criminal Offense. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense Motion To Dismiss Unconstitutional Criminal Offense. 
Defense requests status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Third Response, the Summation, on his motion to Dismiss: Unconstitutional Criminal Offense received and filed.

-Defendant's THIRD RESPONSE, The Summation, on his motion to dismiss: Unconstitutional Criminal Offense from Attorney Bradley J. Bloch on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Bail motion by defense to modify conditions of bond argued and granted by the Court. Court ordered defendant may not possess firearm in the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Motion To Dismiss Unconstitutional Criminal Offense hearing. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered any and all motions by defense are to be filed with the court by March 4 2016.  State's response: March 21, 2016.   
Court ordered case adjourned for decision in Branch 31.  Decision scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing. Arguments heard, no officer's for testimony. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 31.
  Motion hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Second Response in Support of His Motion To Dismiss; Unconstitutional Criminal Offense received and filed.
-Defendant's SECOND Response In Support Of His Motion To Dismiss: Unconstitutional Criminal Offense from Attorney Bradley Bloch on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
State's Supplemental Brief received and filed.
-State's Supplemental Brief from Assistant District Attorney Brittany S. Kachingwe; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing. State needs additional time to re-brief motion.   

Any and all responses are to be filed with the court from the state by October 8, 2015. Defense counsel's response by: November 6, 2015. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Response in Support of His Motion To Dismiss: Unconstitutional Criminal Offense received and filed.
-Defendant's Response In Support Of His Motion To Dismiss: Unconstitutional Criminal Offense from Attorney Bradley J. Bloch on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
State's Reply To Defendant's Motion To Dismiss received and filed.
-State's Reply To Defendant's Motion to Dismiss from Assistant District Attorney Brittany Kachingwe; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Received and filed.
-From Attorney Brad J. Bloch on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.    Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37. State's response to Defense's motion is due by 8/21/15. Defense's reply is due 9/2/15.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
From Defense; received and filed.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sean M Fischer in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:04/17/15
